info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 9:19PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Mecklenburg and Union NC. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 914 PM EDT, Although precipitation is moving east of Union and Mecklenburg Counties, run off of rainfall from this evening is affecting stream basins that were impacted by heavy rainfall on Tuesday as well. Some locations in western and northern Union County have received 1 to 2 inches of rain today and this fell on areas impacted by 2 to 4 inches yesterday. Minor flooding is thus ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - The higher stream levels should be fairly short-lived this evening with the rainfall moving out of the area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Monroe, South Charlotte, East Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill, Indian Trail, Weddington, Stallings, Unionville, Wesley Chapel, Wingate, Lake Park, Hemby Bridge, Fairview In Union County and New Salem. Flooding is most likely along Goose Creek at mill Grove Road. Flooding is also possible along Howey Bottom Road and Stevens Mill Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
